Award.AwardTitle: Functional Architecture of a Histone Deposition Protein

Division.LongName: Div Of Molecular and Cellular Bioscience

Award.AbstractNarration: DNA in all organisms exists in large molecules known as chromosomes. In order to fit huge chromosomes into cells, the DNA is compacted by wrapping around chromatin proteins. The major type of chromatin proteins are the histones. This project will focus on Asf1, a protein that binds to histones and delivers them onto DNA during the construction of chromosomes. During the past grant period, it was demonstrated that Asf1 is regulated by proteins that are required for duplicating DNA molecules. These studies will be extended by asking the following questions: Which proteins interact with Asf1? Where on the chromosomes is the Asf1 protein located? How does Asf1 affect the duplication of DNA molecules? Which portions of the Asf1 protein are required for these different activities?
